sysevent_email_action.message_html:
Downtime Computer(s) in need of review for Business Continuity Access (BCA)

${mail_script:BCA business owner sign-off_script_1}

You have been identified as the person responsible to confirm that the Downtime Computer(s) in your area is ready should Connect become unavailable. Downtime Computers are identified by a red keyboard OR a yellow BCA – Connect Downtime label attached to the monitor.  

Sign into the Downtime Computer listed above. Open this email and click on the link in the upper right of this notification to complete the check list by end of day  ${mail_script:BCA business owner sign-off_script_4}

 

The purpose of the Downtime Computer is to ensure that critical patient data such as reports remain available during planned or unplanned downtimes. Downtime Computer readiness is a crucial part of the Recovery Process. It is part of our upgrade strategy to ensure that Continuity of Care is maintained throughout.  All Downtime Computers across the Organization must be reviewed for Downtime Readiness prior to a planned Connect Upgrade.

 

Want to learn more about Downtime Computer(s)? Click on the link below to watch the BCA PC eLearning.
